intro: Batrachium pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf batrachium, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories, and has fibrous roots that help it anchor in the soil. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a waxy surface, which helps reduce water loss in its humid habitat. Batrachium pumilum is also noted for its small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into berries, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
